author: By Jeanne Cooper
title: Locals-style lodging in London
text:
Page 1 of 1 
New hotel 
London: Hoping to be a local hangout as much as lodgings, the Laslett will offer a library of British art and design books and a restaurant and bar by United Kingdom celebrity chef Sally Clarke , as well as 51 rooms spread across five Victorian town houses in Notting Hill. Reservations are available for stays starting Aug. 15; from $368. www.thelaslett.co.uk 
Seasonal activity 
Florida: It’s open season on scallops in Gulf County’s 
St. Joseph Bay, now through Sept. 24. Pick up a saltwater fishing permit and dive flag before snorkeling in the grass beds dotting the shallow water, wade out or take a group trip from Port St . Joe. www.visitgulf.com 
New tour 
Colombia: Butterfield & Robinson’s newest Places on the Verge itinerary explores cultural attractions in Bogota and Cartagena as well as the natural wonders of Valle del Cocora, home of the wax palm tree, and volcanic Nevados Natural Park. The eight-day hiking and biking excursion departs Nov. 15 and 22; from $6,995. www.butterfield.com 
National park 
South Africa: On Africa’s southernmost tip, Agulhas National Park features a lighthouse in operation since 1849 — and a coastline dotted with shipwrecks from early explorers. Southern right whales come to the area to breed from August to November. www.sanparks.org/parks/agulhas 
Holiday 
New Caledonia: This overseas territory of France, where baguettes can be found as easily as bougna (food cooked in banana leaves) and bami (Indonesian noodles), observes National Day on Tuesday, a.k.a. Bastille Day. The culturally diverse archipelago also celebrates local heritage on New Caledonia Day, Sept. 24.
